instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
I have this board which power cycles n PP5V_S4

PP5V_S5 - 5V
PP5V_S4 - power cycles
P5VS4_EN - power cycles
PM_SLP_S5_L - power cycles
SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN - power cycles
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V
PP3V42_G3H - 3.4V
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.3V

There is no visible liquid around SMC.
Also, how do you test these boards without the attached battery? Is there the easiest way than yanking the battery connector?

Thanks

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
This board should start by itself on charger only.

First try to start in SMC bypass mode; to discard any SMC sensor issue.
Check for short on all secondary voltages.

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Thanks, 2informaticos

SMC bypass power cycles as well, with the fan turning on and off as it cycles.

Probed for shorts around all coils and filtering caps. I haven't found any. 
The lowest reading I've got was around these coils, which is expected I believe.
L7630 - PP1V05_S0_REG_R - 80Ohms
L7430 - PP1V35_S3 - 200Ohms

In SMC bypass mode, the heat signature (3* higher than ambient temp) is pulsing around U3900 - BCM15700. Not sure how it is related unless water corroded some pins underneath the BGA
[ATTACH]59280[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59279[/ATTACH]

SMC and battery charger are warming up, even if no battery is connected
[ATTACH]59281[/ATTACH]

Haven't run it through ultrasonic yet, perhaps should go on that now.

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Check for pulse at all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals and secondary voltages.

ISL6259 works all the time charger is connected; no matters battery is present, or not.

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Thanks

PM_SLP_S5_L - pulsing - 3.3V
PM_SLP_S4_L - pulsing - 3.3V
PM_SLP_S3_L - pulsing - 3.3V

PP5V_S5 - 5V
PP5V_S4 - Pulsing 5V
PP5V_S3 - Pulsing 5V
PP5V_S0 - Pulsing 5V

PP3V3_S5- 3.3V
PP3V3_S4 - Pulsing 3.3V
PP3V3_S3 - Pulsing 3.3V
PP3V3_S0 - Pulsing 3.3V
PP3V3_SUS - 3.3V
PP3V3_S3RSS0_CAMERA - Pulsing 3.3V

PP1V35_S3 - Pulsing 1.3V
PP1V5_S0 - Pulsing 1.5V
PP1V05_SUS - 1.05V

ALL_SYS_PWRGD  - Pulsing 3.3V
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK  - Pulsing 3.3V
PM_DSW_PWRGD - Pulsing 3.3V
SMC_RESET_L - Pulsing 3.3V - 3.42V

CPUVR_PHASE1-3 - Pulsing 1.6V

Let me know if any other voltages you may need?

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Try it with both charger and battery connected.
Just put the board in the chassis and connect battery, no other devices...

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
When the board only is attached to the battery, with a connected charger I get quarter fan spin. 1.28A is drawn to charge the battery. Went like this for a couple of minutes and no more fan spin.

When only on battery no fan spin

When only on the charger - 20mA drawn

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Try known good BIOS file, clean ME.

No liquid sign, but any history available?

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message: Yeah apparently was dropped in a puddle of water. But it seems like it was wiped off. No discoloration marks on the board

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message: I suppose you are using an original 85watts charger , also you can try to get a charged battery , that is if you are using an after market charger

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
You can have accumulated crap under BGA chips.
Heat them with quality flux, just in case...

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message:
Hi [USER=1946]@huzeafa[/USER] yes 80W charger on bench supply.
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], any suggestions of which GBA chips to reflow? I ran it through the ultrasonic and reflowed  U3900 with no luck.

Next will hit SMC.

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message: PCH and SMC should be first to try...

threads.title: 820-3662 PM_SLP_S5_L power cycles
threads.message: No luck here. Will have to give up.
